question: Suppose you have 12 exams in an academic year, and your probability of passing any given one of them is $p = 0.85$. If you wanted to plot a distribution that describes your chance of passing $k$ out of the 12, what would be the most appropriate type of distribution to model this situation?

answers.feedback: Try again. This example does not deal with something that could be modelled as a set of equally likely outcomes.
Try again. A Bernoulli distribution would model your chances of passing/failing one exam, but not 12 of them.
Try again. This example does not have any notion of rate during a time interval.
Correct! The desired distribution can be viewed as a sum of 12 Bernoulli random variables with parameter $p = 0.85$. As described [here](#binomial-distribution), this sum is a binomial distribution.
